item.description:
Our next meetup is on March 17th and we will be learning the simple, but effective, technique of producing HDR (HIGH DYNAMIC RANGE IMAGING). We will be featuring a $79 program called Hydra that works as a stand alone program and also is a plug in for Aperture and Lightroom. If time permits we will also demonstrate Portrait Professional.

There will be gifts given away as door prizes, Hydra WILL be one of those door prizes, compliments of Creaceed. Our special thanks to Topaz Labs for providing the software program "Detail"as a door prize for our past meeting, Anita was the lucky winner.


If you can take three pictures on a tripod for the meetup, we can use them for the program. Take one picture with correct exposure, take a second one under exposed and a third one over exposed. The Hydra program can merge three photos for HDR results whether taken with, or without a tripod, but the resullts are more quickly arrived at if a tripod is used.

"Hydra is about mixing a number of under- and overexposed shots to get a natural sight of a scene. It provides human eye-like perception to your photographs by allowing you to create high dynamic range (HDR) images from a series of regular photographs, either from DSLRs or traditional point-and-shoot cameras."

Hope to see you on the 17th.


No Charge, but donations will be accepted, or if you would like to bring a dish, or refreshment that also would be appreciated.
item.how_to_find_us: Exit 495, exit 31 towards Littleton Common, go left at 1st light with Mobile Station, go about 1/4 mile to our street, across from Yantze River Restaurant make a right on Partridge Lane and go to end of cul de sac. 3 Partridge Lane
